thread.title: MWC football: Boise State routs Colorado State
thread.title_full: MWC football: Boise State routs Colorado State

author: Associated Press
title: MWC football: Boise State routs Colorado State
text:
MWC football: Boise State routs Colorado State Associated Press Posted: 10/10/2015 11:51:49 PM PDT Updated: 10/10/2015 11:51:51 PM PDT Boise State 41, Colorado State 10: Thomas Sperbeck caught two long touchdown passes and sophomore Jeremy McNichols scored his 13th and 14th touchdowns of the season as the No. 25 Broncos (5-1, 2-0 Mountain West) cruised past the Rams (2-4, 0-2) in Fort Collins, Colorado. 
Brett Rypien passed for 339 yards, including an 85-yard touchdown throw to McNichols, who also caught a 53-yard TD pass from wide receiver Shane Williams-Rhodes. 
McNichols scored on a 56-yard scamper but was knocked from the game on a 1-yard TD run late in the third quarter and didn't return. Sperbeck finished with 178 yards on five catches, all in the first half. Nevada 35, New Mexico 17: Tyler Stewart threw two touchdown passes and ran for two, and the Wolf Pack (3-3, 1-1) pulled away late to beat the Lobos (3-3, 1-1) in Reno. Stewart had touchdown runs of 13 and 10 yards to give Nevada a 21-10 lead late in the third quarter. Stewart fumbled to open the fourth quarter, and Nias Martin returned it 77 yards to pull the Lobos to within 21-17. Stewart threw an 8-yard TD pass on the ensuing series. 
New Mexico quarterback Austin Apodaca came off the bench in the fourth quarter and completed seven straight passes, driving to the Wolf Pack 25-yard line. Apodaca then connected with Dameon Gamblin, but Gamblin fumbled while reaching for the goal line with about five minutes left. Nevada's Jordan Dobrich recovered the ball in the end zone. Advertisement Air Force 31, Wyoming 17: Shayne Davern scored twice and safety Brodie Hicks intercepted two passes, helping the Falcons beat the Cowboys in Air Force Academy, Colorado. Receiver Jalen Robinette tossed a 56-yard TD pass to Garrett Brown early in the fourth quarter to seal the win as Air Force (3-2, 2-0) ended a two-game slide against Wyoming (0-6, 0-2). Utah State 56, Fresno State 14: Devante Mays ran for three touchdowns and LaJuan Hunt ran for two as the Aggies (3-2, 2-0) routed the Bulldogs (1-5, 0-3) in Fresno. 
-- ASSOCIATED PRESS
